programme.title: Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie
programme.desc: A criminal organization plots to brainwash the world's deadliest warriors for use as weapons of destruction.

programme.title: Devilman
programme.desc: A powerful demon (Hisato Izaki) tries to prevent an apocalyptic war between his race and mankind.

programme.title: Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie
programme.desc: A criminal organization plots to brainwash the world's deadliest warriors for use as weapons of destruction.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: Moving to a new town is tough, and with no friends, it can be scary; in Satsuki's case, that last part isn't helped any when she, her little brother, and three kids from school end up in the old schoolhouse, which happens to be haunted by ghosts.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Akagami Aogami: A Hand Reaches Out from the Toilet.
programme.desc: Something is stinking up the town, and it isn't just urban reconstruction; a ghost has invaded the school's bathrooms, and it's up to Satsuki and the gang to find out how to put it back to sleep; the old book left by Satsuki's mom just might be it.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Curtain is Raised! The Cursed School Fine Arts Festival.
programme.desc: The big play is coming up, but the boy in the lead role is scared; he makes a wish for the gymnasium to catch fire--and it does; when the play moves to be held in the old schoolhouse, the boy wishes to be injured--and he is.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: While in the old schoolhouse, Satsuki hears a haunting melody drifting through the halls; the only trouble is the lack of a pianist; if Satsuki hears the melody a total of four times, she'll die; the gang saddles up to put the ghostly piano to sleep.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Shrimplips takes over as leader of the Rubberobo gang.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Ikki and Metabee meet a Rubberobo spy while touring Medabot.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: A tree makes Rokusho dream of his past.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Rokusho is challenged to a battle by Metabee.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: When S and G rocket to outer space to mine a radioactive mineral from asteroids, Sonic and Tails stow away.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: When a Rebel Base is threatened by Robotnik, Sonic and Tails team up with Big Mike and Da Bears to run a booby-trapped gauntlet in their gigantic Road Warrior-like truck.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik announces his intention to give up villainy, and Sonic is forced into retirement.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: A half man, half duck named Quark appears with his robot servant in tow, and tries to oust Robotnik.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik acquires a magic wand and a book of spells from Wes Weasley; he tries to destroy the Mobius mint before it can release a Sonic banknote.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik tries to capture Breezy; Robotnik Jr, tries to turn Robotnik Falls into Robotnik Cliffs to cause a drought, and build a robotic wife who can't be drenched by water.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: One of Tails' inventions catches the eye of Professor Dinglehopper, who asks the fox to leave Sonic and become his research assistant.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: An intergalactic bounty-hunter comes to Mobius and attempt to catch Sonic.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic, Wes Weasley and Sergeant Doberman attempt to breach the defences of Robotnik's new fortress, and none of them can stand the sight of each other.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik decides to cripple Mobius' three major transit systems, Rail, Air, and Sea, to fully gain control of the planet; Sonic has to circumnavigate the planet to save the day.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik constructs a P.T. robot in an attempt to increase Scratch, Grounder, and later, Coconuts' fitness; Sonic tries to use Robotnik's equipment against the Robots.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic comes to the rescue of a town that is being held ransom by a crime syndicate.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan arrives on a small island and meets Jimsy, a boy who has been living in the wild; as Conan gets to know his new friend, the ship Barracuda offers an opportunity to finally reach Industria.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Jimsy attempt to stowaway aboard the Barracuda, but are caught and punished by the ship's captain Dyce; they get to work as the ship heads for Industria.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: The Barracuda finally arrives in Industria and Conan and Jimsy are stunned to find it bleak and deserted; Conan races through the complex searching for Lana.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Lana are finally reunited but the villainous Lepka continues to pursue them; shocked by Lepka's brutality, Captain Dyce's allegiances begin to shift.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Dyce leaves Conan trapped in an Industria holding cell and escapes with Lana to the Barracuda; he finds cover in a dense fog but Lepka is close behind.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: With Lepka's gunboat in pursuit, Lana uses a lifeboat to rescue Conan from the open sea.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.desc: As a master thief, Lupin has many secret techniques up his sleeve, and one of them is his Levitation Technique; a crime syndicate plots a trick,where a fake Lupin tortures a man known as X8 and frames the real Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.sub-title: The Wind in Morocco Is Hot
programme.desc: Lupin and his arch-nemesis Inspector Zenigata are kidnapped and are forcibly conscripted into the French Foreign Legion in Morocco; they end up shackled together and have to work together to make a run for it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.desc: Beautiful Swedish twins Latica and Anita engaged in a battle to the death over the Viking treasure map tattooed on their backs, and while in disguise, Lupin learns the map's secret.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.desc: A hit has been ordered on Lupin, and Puma, a formidable hit man who specializes in long-range attacks, is on his trail; Lupin takes his chances with a one-on-one showdown at close range against Puma.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: Before her individual match, Hiromi's pairing changes; her opponent is none other than her idol, Madam Butterfly; faced with Hiromi's unexpected potential, Reika gets serious.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: One day, Hiromi is summoned by Madam Butterfly and presented with a serious issue.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: With Hiromi having returned to the tennis club, Kyoko Otowa resumes her bullying; regardless, Coach Munakata's strict training continues.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: Hiromi wins the tournament and is hailed throughout the school as the second most successful newcomer following Madame Butterfly; Munekata starts training Hiromi and her team hard for tomorrow's final.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: I Like! I Like! I Like! Todo-san

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo's title match with Date begins; Date is surprised by how much better Ippo is since the last time he sparred with him.
